lines.text: [Four ladies, including our heroine, Joan, are headed west on a train. Three of them are comparing notes on their mail-order husbands while snacking. Joan is not participating]

[Looking at a picture]
Oh, yours has got bushy eyebrows; he'll tickle ya every time he kisses ya.

[Talking with her mouth full]
I don't care
[giggles]
as long as he kisses me.
[the three of them laugh riotously, while Joan looks annoyed]

[Leaning forward, holding a banana up to her mouth]
You know what they say about men with bushy eyebrows and a long nose?

[Pushes Queenie back, and forcing the banana halfway down her throat]
Aw, Queenie, I can tell you've been married before!
[the three women cackle and continue eating, while Joan tries to ignore them]
Mine's got a Buick, and a Ford, and an Indian squaw to do heavy work.
Aw, that ain't nuthin'. Mine's got a radio and a bathroom with runnin' water. I think it's in the picture he sent me.
Did he send a picture of himself *in* the bath?
[the three of them crack up again. Joan rolls her eyes]

[to Joan]
Say, has yours got plumbin'? Or is it one of them farmhouses, ya know, with a telephone booth in the back yard?
I don't know.
lines.character: Joan Gordon, aka Francine La Rue

lines.text: She don't know? Can ya tie that?
Oh well, she won't be so almighty calm when it's forty below zero and she has to get up in the middle of the night.
[She waves the stub of her banana triumphantly as the other two laugh]
Ya daffy little tahmata, I'm bugs about ya. I'd marry ya myself, if I wasn't already married.

I've been up and down Broadway since I was fifteen years old. I'm fed up with hoofing in shows. I'm sick of night clubs, hustlers, bootleggers, chislers, and smart guys. I've heard all the questions and I know all the answers. And I've kept myself... fairly respectable through it all. The whole atmosphere of this street gives me a high-powered headache. I've got a chance to breathe something else, and boy, I'm grabbing it.
lines.character: Joan Gordon, aka Francine La Rue

lines.text: Pick up the marbles, hon, you win.

[Hands him some jewelry]
By the way, here's a couplea trinkets I want to return to you. Might as well do it now.
lines.character: Joan Gordon, aka Francine La Rue

lines.text: Sure you don't want to keep this hardware?
Positive.
lines.character: Joan Gordon, aka Francine La Rue

lines.text: [Reaches into a drawer, takes out a key, and hands it to him]
All through playing house?
All through, Eddie. Thanks.
lines.character: Joan Gordon, aka Francine La Rue

lines.text: Well, so long kid. It was swell while it lasted.

[Almost smiling, softly]
Yeah.
lines.character: Joan Gordon, aka Francine La Rue

lines.text: [Eddie turns and leaves]
Say, when a guy like him marries a doll like you, I'll kiss your... foot... in Macy's window at high noon.
No college boy still wet behind the ears is going to bust us up.
No be a good little boy and don't get yourself all in a lather.
lines.character: Joan Gordon, aka Francine La Rue

lines.text: Gee, with a hundred dollars, maybe I could get myself a husband right here in town.
Of course, you could!
lines.character: Joan Gordon, aka Francine La Rue

lines.text: And then I'd sort of, eh, have a chance to, try the goods before I bought it!
Emily...
lines.character: Joan Gordon, aka Francine La Rue

lines.text: And by joining hands, I now pronounce that they are man and wife. Three dollars, please.
lines.character: Elmer, the Justice of the Peace

lines.text: Look at her blush! Colorin' up like a tomato.
How do you enjoy married life?
Oh, it's alright.
lines.character: Joan Gordon, aka Francine La Rue

lines.text: Nothing like it, after you get used to it. I've been married and divorced twice; so, I ought to know.
Isn't love the one thing you don't have to earn?
lines.character: Joan Gordon, aka Francine La Rue

lines.text: Have you ever heard a woman scream?
lines.character: Joan Gordon, aka Francine La Rue

lines.text: No.
Well, you're going to.
lines.character: Joan Gordon, aka Francine La Rue

lines.text: Huh?
'Cause I've been dying to do it for months. Ahhhhhhhhhhh!
lines.character: Joan Gordon, aka Francine La Rue

lines.text: Jim! You've caught one of those terrible summer colds. Why, you'll have to take some quinine and some hot lemonade and a hot water bottle. And I'm going to put you right to bed!
lines.character: Joan Gordon, aka Francine La Rue

lines.text: [Devilish smile followed by a kiss]
